intro: Achillea wilhelmsii, commonly known as the German yarrow, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It features finely divided, feathery leaves and flat, composite flower heads that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides. Achillea wilhelmsii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
